page.title: 02Farming
page.content: The village is surrounded by farms many of which concentrate on pig breeding In the nearby village of Britwell Salome a farmer initiated a method of breeding pigs in open fields rather than in enclosed sties. The fields are dotted with corrugated iron roofed huts, each large enough to house a sow and her litter. The pigs take some fpod from the field but this is supplemented by food and water brought by the farmer. A more modern version of the huts is made of fibre glass moulded to shape. Because of their shape and colour they resemble igloos and are colloquially named 'pigloos'.
